Uses of Interface
edu.brown.cs.wh7.suggestion.Candidate

  • Packages that use Candidate 
    Package Description
    edu.brown.cs.wh7.autocorrect  
    edu.brown.cs.wh7.suggestion
    This package contains classes related to making suggestions for autocorrect.

    • Uses of Candidate in edu.brown.cs.wh7.autocorrect

      Methods in edu.brown.cs.wh7.autocorrect that return types with arguments of type Candidate 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Candidate> Engine.makeBasicCandidates(HashSet<String> strs, String prev)
      Method to created a list of BasicCandidates that represent the suggested words.
      List<Candidate> Engine.makeSmartCandidates(HashSet<String> strs, String prev, String toMatch)
      Method to created a list of SmartCandidates that represent the suggested words.

    • Uses of Candidate in edu.brown.cs.wh7.suggestion

      Classes in edu.brown.cs.wh7.suggestion with type parameters of type Candidate 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Ranker<T extends Candidate>
      A class to rank candidates that represent suggestions for an input.
      class  SmartRanker<T extends Candidate>
      This class implements my smart ranking system for the autocorrect program.
      Classes in edu.brown.cs.wh7.suggestion that implement Candidate 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BasicCandidate
      This class represents a suggestion object that can be compared in order to rank suggestions from the Trie.
      class  SmartCandidate
      This class is used to create candidates based on a smart-ranking system of creating a score based on different aspects of the suggested word.
      Methods in edu.brown.cs.wh7.suggestion with parameters of type Candidate 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int Ranker.compare(Candidate c1, Candidate c2)
      Method to compare two Candidates based on Bigram frequency of the previous input word, then unigram frequency of the phrase, and finally alphabetical order.
      int SmartRanker.compare(Candidate c1, Candidate c2)
      Compare method to ascertain which candidate has a higher score.
